movesets.name: Choice Scarf

items.name: Choice Scarf
items.description: Hold item which raises Speed by 50%, but locks holder into one move.

movesets.description:
Moves

Once again, Fire Blast is the main move of this set, as its power is useful for revenge killing purposes and cleaning late-game. Dark Pulse serves the same purpose as a complementary STAB, and is a good move to spam with its great neutral coverage. Destiny Bond takes out any Pokemon Houndour can't KO once it has done its job. The last slot is mostly filler; Flamethrower is a more reliable Fire STAB with better accuracy at the cost of a bit of power, while Pursuit can be used for trapping purposes, but is weak and easy to take advantage of.

Set Details

The EVs maximize power and Speed, with leftover EVs thrown into Attack and Special Defense. Hasty nature allows Houndour to outspeed Choice Scarf Pawniard and Speed tie with Choice Scarf Mienfoo, two important pokemon that Houndour definitely wants to outspeed. Use 36 Defense EVs with a Timid nature if Pursuit is not used. As Houndour won't be able to break through Porygon anyway, Flash Fire has a bit more merit on this set, but Early Bird can still be used for absorbing sleep status.

Usage Tips

This set works best late-game, when it can sweep through weakened teams with Fire Blast or Dark Pulse. It also can be used to take out threatening Pokemon with Destiny Bond earlier in the game, or to revenge kill Pokemon such as Pawniard.

Team Options

This set still needs things to handle Fighting-types, so Trubbish and Croagunk are again excellent choices. This set likes entry hazard support for easier cleaning; Dwebble and again, Trubbish, are good choices for hazard layers. As Houndour will need to switch out often, Rapid Spin support from Drilbur is appreciated even more. Carvanha and Scraggy again work well with Houndour as they can weaken or KO each other's checks.

movesets.name: Mixed Attacker

items.name: Life Orb
items.description: Boosts power by 30%, user takes 10% recoil each turn it attacks.

movesets.description:
Moves

Fire Blast is the strongest move on this set, capable of 2HKOing many defensive Pokemon, and the one it will be spamming most of the time once Houndour gets in safely. Dark Pulse is a more accurate secondary STAB with a nice flinch chance, getting near-perfect coverage alongside Fire Blast as well as super effective coverage on Ghost- and Psychic-types. Sucker Punch is Houndour's tool for taking out Pokemon that outspeed it or are using slower priority, such as Fletchling, although it is unreliable and can be taken advantage of. Destiny Bond can take out slower opponents, forcing a trade with one of Houndour's checks and possibly opening up a sweep for something else. Pursuit, on the other hand, ensures that the Ghost-types Houndour naturally checks don't get away for free. Substitute is a decent move that eases prediction, but is generally inferior to the listed moves.

Set Details

The EV spread maximizes Special Attack and Speed with one point invested into Attack and Special Defense each. A Hasty nature lets Houndour hit 17 Speed, an important benchmark, while lowering Houndour's already pathetic Defense stat. 0 HP IVs are used to minimize recoil from Life Orb. The choice between Early Bird and Flash Fire is personal preference. Early Bird lets Houndour get around Trace Porygon and absorb sleep, mainly Foongus's Spore. Flash Fire gives Houndour an immunity to Fire-type moves, including Will-O-Wisp, and can power up Fire Blast when switching into them, but Houndour will have trouble switching into most users of these moves anyway. Life Orb is by far the best item for this set in order to hit as hard as possible while being able to switch moves.

Usage Tips

In general, Houndour shouldn't be switched in on predicted attacking moves it isn't immune to, as it takes a lot of damage even from resisted attacks. Bringing Houndour in after a teammate is KOed or after a slow U-turn or Volt Switch is the best way to get it in safely. Prediction is key when using Houndour, as letting a check such as Timburr in for free on Sucker Punch can be disastrous, while not using Sucker Punch against a faster opponent will usually lead to Houndour's end.

Team Options

Houndour appreciates teammates that can deal with Fighting-types. Trubbish and Croagunk do this well. As it is weak to Stealth Rock, entry hazard removal is a good idea when using Houndour; Drilbur, Vullaby, and Archen are all viable choices for this role. Sticky Web, while not being a particularly effective strategy in Little Cup, pairs very nicely with a Pokemon as strong as Houndour, fixing its Speed issues. Volt Switch and U-turn support is one of the best ways get Houndour on the field safely, and Chinchou, Magnemite, and Mienfoo are the most notable users of these moves. Lastly, another Dark-type such as Scraggy or Carvanha forms a good offensive core with Houndour, as Houndour can lure out one of their shared checks and take it out with Destiny Bond.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Beat Up
moves.description: All healthy Pokemon aid in damaging the target.

moves.name: Bite
moves.description: 10% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Body Slam
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Captivate
moves.description: Lowers an opposite gender foe's Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Charm
moves.description: Lowers foe's Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Counter
moves.description: If hit by a physical attack, returns double the damage.

moves.name: Crunch
moves.description: 20% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Dark Pulse
moves.description: 20% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Destiny Bond
moves.description: If the user faints, the foe faints.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Double-Edge
moves.description: Has 1/3 recoil.

moves.name: Dream Eater
moves.description: Leeches 50% of the damage dealt. Only works if target is asleep.

moves.name: Embargo
moves.description: Item use is prevented for five turns.

moves.name: Ember
moves.description: 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Feint
moves.description: Only works if the foe uses Detect or Protect; nullifies effects of those moves.

moves.name: Feint Attack
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Fire Blast
moves.description: 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Fire Fang
moves.description: 10% chance to flinch. 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Fire Spin
moves.description: Prevents the opponent from attacking for 2-5 turns.

moves.name: Flame Charge
moves.description: Boosts user's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Flamethrower
moves.description: 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Foul Play
moves.description: Uses the target's Attack stat in damage calculation.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Headbutt
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch the target.

moves.name: Heat Wave
moves.description: 10% chance to burn.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Howl
moves.description: Boosts Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Hyper Voice
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Incinerate
moves.description: Removes the target's Berry.

moves.name: Inferno
moves.description: Burns the target.

moves.name: Iron Tail
moves.description: 30% chance to lower Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Leer
moves.description: Lowers target's Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Mimic
moves.description: Copies the last move used by the target.

moves.name: Mud-Slap
moves.description: Lowers accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Nasty Plot
moves.description: Boosts Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Natural Gift
moves.description: Power and type depends on the user's held Berry.

moves.name: Nightmare
moves.description: Does 1/4 of the target's max HP per turn to a sleeping target.

moves.name: Odor Sleuth
moves.description: Blocks evasion modifiers. Allows Fighting- and Normal-type moves to hit Ghosts.

moves.name: Overheat
moves.description: Lowers Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Payback
moves.description: Base Power doubles if the foe has taken its turn.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Punishment
moves.description: Does more damage to foes with stat boosts.

moves.name: Pursuit
moves.description: Doubles in power if the target switches, and hits them before they can escape.

moves.name: Rage
moves.description: Boosts Atk 1 stage if hit.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Retaliate
moves.description: Power doubles if the user's teammate fainted the previous turn.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Reversal
moves.description: Does more damage as HP decreases.

moves.name: Roar
moves.description: Forces a switch to a random Pokemon.

moves.name: Rock Smash
moves.description: 50% chance to lower Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Role Play
moves.description: Copies the foe's ability and overwrites the user's ability.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Secret Power
moves.description: Effects vary with terrain.

moves.name: Shadow Ball
moves.description: 20% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Sludge Bomb
moves.description: 30% chance to poison.

moves.name: Smog
moves.description: 40% chance to poison.

moves.name: Snarl
moves.description: Lowers target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Snatch
moves.description: If certain moves are used, the user of Snatch uses the moves instead.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Solar Beam
moves.description: Charges up turn 1; attacks on turn 2.

moves.name: Spite
moves.description: Lowers the PP of the move used last by 1-5.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Sucker Punch
moves.description: The user always moves first. Will only work if the foe attacked.

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.description: Summons sun for 5 turns.

moves.name: Super Fang
moves.description: Does damage equal to half the foe's current HP.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Swift
moves.description: Always hits.

moves.name: Taunt
moves.description: Forces the foe to use damaging moves for 2 turns.

moves.name: Thief
moves.description: Steals target's item.

moves.name: Thunder Fang
moves.description: 10% chance to flinch. 10% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Torment
moves.description: Prevents the target from using the same move twice in a row.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: Uproar
moves.description: Repeats for 2-5 turns. No Pokemon can sleep during these turns.

moves.name: Will-O-Wisp
moves.description: Burns the foe.

abilities.name: Flash Fire
abilities.description: Grants immunity to Fire and increases Fire's power 50% when hit by a Fire move.

abilities.name: Unnerve
abilities.description: Prevents the foe from consuming its held Berry item.
